en: I don't like his way of talking.
zh: 我不喜欢他说话的方式。

en: I found listening to him very interesting.
zh: 我觉得听他说话特别有意思。

en: It is very interesting to listen to him.
zh: 听他聊天挺有趣的。

en: What he had said proved to be a myth.
zh: 事实证明，他说的话都是瞎编的。

en: We found out that what he said wasn't true.
zh: 我们发现他说的话根本不是真的。

en: His speech verged on the ridiculous.
zh: 他的话简直荒谬得可笑。

en: His story is highly colored.
zh: 他的故事色彩渲染得太重了。

en: His speech turned us off.
zh: 他的讲话让我们感到很扫兴。

en: I felt drawn to his story.
zh: 我被他的故事深深吸引了。

en: As he spoke, pictures came into my mind.
zh: 他说话的时候，我脑子里就有画面了。

en: His speech got awfully boring.
zh: 他的话听起来越来越无聊了。

en: His talk led me to believe that he knows a great deal.
zh: 听他谈吐，我觉得他见多识广。

en: I cannot say how far his story is true.
zh: 我不好说他的故事到底有几分是真的。

en: I cannot appreciate his logic.
zh: 我真的理解不了他的逻辑。

en: His paper was, on the whole, satisfactory.
zh: 总的来说，他的论文还是挺让人满意的。

en: His thesis leaves nothing to be desired.
zh: 他的论文写得非常完美，无可挑剔。

en: His paper reads like a novel.
zh: 他的论文读起来跟小说似的。

en: His paper is superior to mine.
zh: 他的论文写得比我的好。

en: His paper is better than mine.
zh: 他的论文写得比我的强。

en: His essay is better than mine.
zh: 他的文章写得比我的好。

en: His paper confronts the question of child abuse in nuclear families.
zh: 他的论文探讨了核心家庭中的虐待儿童问题。

en: His thesis doesn't make sense. To begin with, its theme is obscure.
zh: 他的论文逻辑不通，首先主题就很模糊。

en: His paper is far from satisfactory.
zh: 他的论文一点儿都不尽如人意。

en: His manners proclaim him a gentleman.
zh: 从他的举止就能看出他是个绅士。

en: His manners are not those of a gentleman.
zh: 他的举止一点儿也不像个绅士。
